reviews.review: увлекательная игра,прошол за 2 дня...но играть буду снова и снова) Вот уже несколько лет я прохожу эту игру снова и снова и она не может надоесть) Сыну тоже игра зашла)

I can't recommend this game ENOUGH. To be clear, my steam says I've only been playing this game for half an hour, but I've replayed the single player AND multiplayer twice over on my Xbox.
The first thing that made this the best game I've ever played, was how clever it was. Not JUST the puzzles, but everything. The story, the characters, design, and visuals are all just amazing.
Anyway I'm not going to write a full length review, since I can't say anything that hasn't already been said about this game. But my point is;
If you haven't played this game, (as well as the first one) then buy it. Not a single day goes by without me thinking about how amazing this game is. Do yourself a favour and CLICK THAT ADD TO CART BUTTON.

Portal 2 jsem objevil až teď koncem dubna, kdy byla na Steamu slevová akce. Hru jsem na zkoušku spustil a nakonec u ní vydržel skoro 6 hodin v kuse, než jsem únavou odpadnul. Logická hra s neotřelým nápadem chytne každého, kdo si rád láme hlavu. Už se těším na řešení záhad v týmu, co pro nás autoři hry připravili na kooperaci :) Za mě hodnotím hru 9,9/10 -- tím 0,1 dávám autorům šanci na ještě lepší zážitek z případného Portal 3 ;))

Hysterical commentary and addicting puzzles. I got so sucked in to paying this game that I almost beat it on the first day I got it!

Some of the negative reviews here aren't too detailed, so I'll try my best to change that.  I'd like to offer some valid reasons why I can't recommend this game. Of course they're my personal observations, and the issues won't affect everyone, but they could affect *you*.

[u]Major Issue: Bugs[/u]

Bugs in over 35% of the wretched puzzle rooms. Whether it was pixel hunting for the correct atom of usable wall to pop a portal on, or the game presenting busted mechanics you cannot work around as there is only one solution to everything. Sometimes repeating the same action five times would result in four failures and one success. Most of the time I had to reload an older save to start that area all over again, hoping that this time the puzzle would be functional. In a puzzle game, these bugs are not so much game-breaking as fun-breaking. I only realised something was amiss when I consulted a YouTube walkthrough, and found out I was doing the right thing but the game was bugged. 

I'm now stuck on (what feels like) the nadir of the game. I'm in a glitched puzzle where Stephen Merchant keeps yammering at me in an attempt to be funny. This room (Wheatley puzzle 17 I think, blue tunnel of light going horizontally) has murdered the game for me. I just don't have the interest in it to bother completing this room. Tried the video walkthroughs, but guess what? The wall others can use, I can't!  To play a game where I can't tell when it's bugged or not is literally gaming torture. 

Second smaller gripe: Stephen Merchant's voice acting. Holy flurking schnit, who thought this was a good idea?! I'm English, but this man's voice gets on my nerves, let alone his awful attempt at jokes and ad-libbing. With all the reloading I've had to do, I've heard his rotten material probably sixty times more than other players.

Multiplayer wasn't free of bugs either, and after trying it once I didn't return to it for a very good reason. Whether it was lag or bugs/glitches, bits of these puzzles didn't work either. Marvellous! 

[i]Summation[/i]

If you are intent on getting the game, I'd heartily recommend getting it discounted. Of course, you may not experience these bugs. My friends didn't - their run through was completely fine. Nor can I explain why over 50% of the game bugged out. The faulty turret puzzle was the first major issue that halted progress for days, as the only cure was reloading old saves before I had entered a 'bugged' area. Can you imagine how much of a pain that was, having to reload whole areas because one room's puzzle wouldn't let me through? There are no backdoors or workarounds, so when something goes wrong, it completely blocks your progress.

I really wanted to enjoy this game, as there are some really good elements. I loved controlling the liquid so I could make new portals. I didn't have a problem with this element at all, and it was lovely to experience it working properly. The super-bouncy areas were a lot of fun too. I also enjoyed seeing the roots of Aperture Science, and GLAdOS's history. 

The bugs utterly ruined it for me. You can't afford to have bugs in a puzzle game that requires precision, timing, and thought from the player: It's like performing surgery with a carrot instead of a scalpel.

(re-doing my earlier review now that I've done multiplayer and fan-made maps)
Single player: good follow up to Portal, very fun. Just the right length at around 10 hours.
Co-operative: even more challenging and fun. Around the same length as single player, however even with the DLC I would have liked a bit more.
Fan-made maps & map builder: Once you're done with the campaigns you can then play fan-made maps or make your own. SOME of the fan-made maps are worth a play.
Overall: very good

Usually sequels aren't as great as the originals but in this case I already feel that it has surpassed the first game. The voice acting is great and has made me laugh out loud numerous times while the puzzles do not disappoint. I would recommend this game to everyone but of course only after they have played Portal.

Ein wirklich tolles Spiel. Nach dem schon sehr bekannten Portal Spiel kam Portal 2 mit vielen interessanten Neuereungen die es nicht haben Langweilig werden lassen. Die Story ist sehr spannend und die beiden KIs GlaDOS und Wheatley sind zwei sehr unterhaltsame und tolle Charaktere. Dazu kommt der neue Koop Modus und die Community Testkammern. Im Fazit viele tolle Neuerungen, ein tolles Gameplay, interessante Story und Charaktere. Eine tolle Kombination! 100% Kaufempfehlung. Es lohnt sich!

Hervorragender - wenn nicht sogar Bester - Titel bei Steam im Genre: Koop-Tüftelei. Die Entwicklungszeit nach Portal merkt man dem Nachfolger zweifelsfrei positiv an. Sowohl Leveldesign, Ingame Physics und Soundtrack als auch Spielspaß suchen Ihresgleichen. Empfehle Portal 2 unbedingt zu Zweit ausprobieren!!! ;-D FAZIT: Wer in Anbetracht der leicht altbacken wirkenden 3D-Grafik ein Auge zudrücken kann, bekommt einen Vorzeige-Titel von Valve geboten. - Wir sind gespannt, ob man uns in absehbarer Zeit (dato 2014) einen dritten Teil gönnt.

[b] [u] GENERAL [/u] [/b]
This game is your ordinary platformer but with portal guns. Overcome obstacles and plow your way through robotics facility taken over by a giant robot. The portal guns offer unique game play as you can create a portal in almost any surface. Use the portal for your own advantage. Moving blocks, misplacing enemies, or even create a shortcut for yourself. Anything is possible with the portal gun.


[b] [u] PROS - [+] [/u] [/b]
+ Different game play from another platformer
+ Unique character models
+ Interesting plot
+ Multiplayer support
+ Sandbox mode for multiplayer
+ Great graphics and physics

[b] [u] CONS - [x] [/u] [/b]
x Multiple achievements require multiplayer games

[b] [u] CONCLUSION - [8/10] [/u] [/b]
I'd say 8/10 is a perfect fit. If this game is on sale then it's a must buy. Your library won't be completed without any Portal series games. Different difficulties in each stage made this game a fun addition compared to another platformer. Beautiful graphics and great story line is another points for this game.
